overview.definition: An open-source, cross-platform, back-end JavaScript runtime environment. Allows JavaScript code to be run on server-side, outside a web browser.
overview.engine: Runs on the Chrome V8 JavaScript engine.
overview.architecture: Single-threaded, non-blocking, asynchronous. Memory efficient & suitable for numerous concurrent connections without waiting.

Description.use_case: Server-side scripting (back end development). Can create web servers, interact with the file system, manage databases, build APIs.

key_features.async_non_blocking_io: Instead of waiting for operations to complete, continue executing other code. Handles results via callbacks or Promises.
key_features.single_threaded_event_loop: Manages asynchronous operations efficiently without overhead of multiple threads.
key_features.modules: Uses a module system to organize code and include libraries.

Description.overview: Built-in module for creating HTTP servers and clients. Allows Node.js applications to act as a web server, listens for incoming requests, and sends back responses.
Description.use_case: Building web servers and APIs. Handling `GET`, `POST`, `PUT`, `DELETE`, etc requests. Serving static files or dynamic content.
Description.key_features_syntax:
`http.createServer(callback)`: Creates an HTTP server object. Callback receives `req` and `res`. 
`server.listen(port, [hostname], [callback])`: Starts the server.

Description.security: You must **NEVER** put database credentials (`host`, `user`, `password`) in client-side JS, as anyone can see them.

Description.overview: Objects automatically passed to the callback function provided to `http.createServer()`.
Description.req: Incoming message: Represents client's request. Includes `req.url`, `req.method`, `req.headers`, and event listeners `req.on('data', ...)` and `req.on('end', ...)`.
Description.res: Server Response: represents the response the server will send back. Includes `res.writeHead()`, `res.write()`, and `res.end()`. `res.end()` MUST be called.
Description.use_case: Essential for inspecting incoming requests (URL, method, headers, body) and crafting the appropriate response (status code, headers, body content).

Description.overview: Built in File System module. Provides functions for interacting with the file system on the server.
Description.use_case: Reading file contents (serving HTML). Writing data to files (logging). Deleting files. Checking if files exist.
Description.key_features_syntax: `fs.readFile(path, callback)`: reads entire content of a file asynchronously. `fs.writeFile(path, data, callback)`: writes entire content of a file asynchronously. `fs.unlink(path, callback)`: deletes file asynchronously.

Description.overview: Node.js's built-in module for parsing URL strings.
Description.use_case: Extracting different parts of a URL, especially path and query parameters from `req.url` in an HTTP server.
Description.key_features_syntax: `url.parse(urlString, [parseQueryString], [slashesDenoteHost])`. `parseQueryString` (Boolean): if `true`, the `query` property will be an *object*. Always set to `true` when working with `req.url`.
Description.returned_object_properties: `pathname`: path section before query string. `query`: an object of key-value pairs. `host`: hostname and port. `search`: full query string with `?`.

Description.overview: Part of the CommonJS module system. `require(modulePath)`: built-in function to import a module. `exports`: object within a module; anything assigned to `exports` becomes available.
Cross-Origin Resource Sharing. A browser security feature that **blocks** client-side requests (like AJAX) to a different _origin_ (domain) than the one that served the HTML page.
The **server** (your Node.js app) must explicitly _allow_ the request by sending the header: `Access-Control-Allow-Origin: "*"` (or a-specific-domain.com).

Description.syntax:
1. const db = mysql.createConnection(...)
2. db.connect(...)
3. db.query(sql, (err, result) => { ... })

Description.overview: Method of the `res` object used to send HTTP status code and response headers back to the client.
Description.syntax:
`res.writeHead(statusCode, [statusMessage], [headers]);`
`statusCode`: 3-digit HTTP status code (200, 404). 
`headers`: Object containing header key-value pairs (e.g., `{ 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }`).
Description.use_case: Setting success/error status. Specifying content type (`text/html`, `application/json`). Configuring CORS headers.
Description.gotchas: Should be called once per response, before `res.write()` or `res.end()`.

Description.built_in: Included in Node.js; no separate installation. Imported with module name: `require('http')`, `require('fs')`. Cover essential tasks.
Description.third_party: Must be installed using `npm install <module-name>`. Creates a `node_modules` folder. Imported using the module name: `require('mysql')`. Provides numerous functionalities (database connectors, web frameworks).

Description.overview: String passed to `require()` for module location.
